etymologies: mid 19th century: from Latin efferent- ‘carrying out’, from the verb efferre, from ex- ‘out’ + ferre ‘carry’

definitions: conducted or conducting outward or away from something (for nerves, the central nervous system; for blood vessels, the organ supplied)

examples.text: efferent neurons carry impulses outwards to the effector organs

shortDefinitions: conducted or conducting outwards or away from something for nerves, central nervous system
